titleStmt.title: CHristian Reader, the many literall and punctuall faults, toge∣ther with those that violate Rules of Orthographie, impute ra∣ther to others hast or ill speed, then to my ignorance or incircumspe∣ction. Mistakes peruerting sense, or making the Author absurd, bee pleased to correct with thy pen, before thou reade.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: CHristian Reader, the many literall and punctuall faults, toge∣ther with those that violate Rules of Orthographie, impute ra∣ther to others hast or ill speed, then to my ignorance or incircumspe∣ction. Mistakes peruerting sense, or making the Author absurd, bee pleased to correct with thy pen, before thou reade.

monogr.title: A briefe exposition vvith notes, vpon the second epistle to the Thessalonians. By VVilliam Sclater Doctor of Diuinitie, and minister of Pitmister in Summerset
monogr.author: Sclater, William

div.head: CHristian Reader, the many literall and punctuall faults, together with those that violate Rules of Orthographie, impute rather to others hast or ill speed, then to my ignorance or incircumspection. Mistakes peruerting sense, or making the Author absurd, bee pleased to correct with thy pen, before thou reade.
div.p:
